channel.title: 317 Help
channel.description:
this is probably extremely simple, im just retarded.
In my run file, i edited the Start Javaw to "C:/Program files (x86)/java/jre6/bin/java.exe" because 317's dont work on 64 bit's unless u have that. I tried to Change and upload one with Start Javaw (because most ppl use that) but they get an error "Retrying to Download Cache - Retrying in 10..) or something.
Can someone help me just upload the client with start javaw?

item.title: 317 Help
item.dc:creator: @Tatemo Tatemo
item.description:
@Tatemo wrote:

It better if you put pause instead of exit. I don’t really know all that much about clients anyway and this is in the wrong section. But the problem is

“C:/Program files (x86)/java/jre6/bin/java.exe” -Xmx500m -cp .;Theme.jar Gui

Read full topic

item.title: 317 Help
item.dc:creator: @db0wzz db0wzz
item.description:
@db0wzz wrote:

the one i use is -
@echo off
“C:/Program files (x86)/java/jre6/bin/java.exe” -Xmx500m -cp .;Theme.jar Gui
exit

One others should use

@echo off
Start Javaw -Xmx500m -cp .;Theme.jar Gui
exit

Read full topic

item.title: 317 Help
item.dc:creator: @Tatemo Tatemo
item.description:
@Tatemo wrote:

Hmmmm. Does the client contain a cache? Paste the Run.bat code exactly please.

Read full topic

item.title: 317 Help
item.dc:creator: @db0wzz db0wzz
item.description:
@db0wzz wrote:

this isnt to help me… its for other people, they DLed the client uploaded with the directory, and they haveto make it Start Javaw in order to play it, if mine has start javaw in it i click twice and client closes. so what it tried to do is upload the client with Start Javaw, and my friends Download it, extract, run and There client just has the Cache error.

Read full topic

item.title: 317 Help
item.dc:creator: @Tatemo Tatemo
item.description:
@Tatemo wrote:

I just told you in my above post what to do…

You need to find your java directory that contains java.exe or whatever you want to run. And then paste that over the top of your current directory.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @db0wzz db0wzz
item.description:
@db0wzz wrote:

ok…so can u guide me >.>

Read full topic

item.title: 317 Help
item.dc:creator: @Tatemo Tatemo
item.description:
@Tatemo wrote:

No. I am not going to do it for you. That helps no one. You will eventually encounter this problem again and you need to know how to fix it by yourself. All I can do is guide.

Read full topic

anyway u could come on teamviewer or something?

item.title: 317 Help
item.dc:creator: @Tatemo Tatemo
item.description:
@Tatemo wrote:

“jre6” needs some additional letters + numbers.

Also I don’t think that error is caused by your run.bat code.

Read full topic
